name: Comedy Central Presents
overview: These half-hour specials showcased some of the best up-and-coming comedians of the moment. The show was a pivotal stepping stone for many of today's stand-up stars.

episodes.name: Wanda Sykes-Hall
episodes.overview: Wanda Sykes-Hall confronts the realities of marriage, children and celebrity sex scandals in this half-hour stand-up special.

episodes.name: Marc Maron
episodes.overview: Comedy Central Presents an all-new half-hour of stand-up from comedian Marc Maron.

episodes.name: Reggie McFadden
episodes.overview: Reggie McFadden explores the perils of dating big women and smoking crack at the club in this half-hour special.

episodes.name: Lewis Black
episodes.overview: Lewis Black questions the effectiveness of flu shots and the US Congress in this half-hour stand-up special.

episodes.name: Greg Fitzsimmons
episodes.overview: Greg Fitzsimmons ponders the problems with human cloning and envisioning your grandpa naked in this half-hour stand-up special.

episodes.name: Mitch Hedberg
episodes.overview: Mitch Hedberg shares his unorthodox solutions to life's little problems in this mind-altering half-hour stand-up special.

episodes.name: Sue Murphy
episodes.overview: Sue Murphy warns against home tanning and exercising at the gym in this half-hour stand-up special.

episodes.name: Kevin Brennan
episodes.overview: Kevin Brennan states the facts behind Biblical stories and explains the miracle of human reproduction in this half-hour special.

episodes.name: Kevin Nealon
episodes.overview: Kevin Nealon considers cooking with wine and cross-country skiing across small countries in this half-hour comedy special.

episodes.name: Margaret Smith
episodes.overview: Margaret Smith shares her tactics for buying underwear and dealing with creditors in this half-hour stand-up special.

episodes.name: Greg Proops

episodes.name: Hugh Fink
episodes.overview: Hugh Fink defends the great American traditions of useless first-base coaches and corrupt boxing in this stand-up special.

episodes.name: Kevin Meaney
episodes.overview: Comedy Central presents a half hour of stand-up from Kevin Meaney.

episodes.name: Dave Attell
episodes.overview: Dave Attell enlightens viewers on the finer aspects of drinking, brawling and blacking-out in this half-hour stand-up special.

episodes.name: Mario Cantone
episodes.overview: Mario Cantone obsesses over sensational trials and obnoxious figure skaters in this half-hour stand-up special.

episodes.overview: Patton Oswalt explores the depravity of reality television in this half-hour standup special.

episodes.name: Elvira Kurt
episodes.overview: Elvira Kurt remembers a time when jungle-gyms were dangerous and tampons didn't have websites in this half-hour special.

episodes.name: Jack Coen
episodes.overview: Jack Coen considers the pros and cons of aging, fatherhood and vasectomies in this half-hour stand-up special.

episodes.name: Don D.C. Curry

episodes.name: Rickey Smiley
episodes.overview: Rickey Smiley recounts his experience with an elderly stripper, impersonates a little old lady reading church announcements and explains black funerals.

episodes.name: Ty Barnett
episodes.overview: Ty Barnett imagines a heaven that doesn't allow nerds, explains why he wasn't cut out for street gangs and suggest that FEMA members should watch more action films.

episodes.name: DeRay
episodes.overview: DeRay Davis talks about his grim childhood, debates going Dutch on dates and reveals his favorite type of woman.

episodes.name: Rod Man
episodes.overview: Rod Man talks about getting short-changed at church, admits that the heat would keep him from participating in a Civil Rights march and describes his stint at Cracker Barrel.

episodes.name: Steve Byrne
episodes.overview: Steve Byrne offers a trick for avoiding political discussions, describes the worst thing that can happen in a car and explains why he hates renting movies.

episodes.name: Mike Birbiglia (2)
episodes.overview: Mike Birbiglia laments his dreams of being a rapper and vents about his annoyance over "Olive Garden Italian."

episodes.name: Ted Alexandro (2)
episodes.overview: Ted Alexandro recalls his time as a music teacher in New York City public schools, examines modern hip hop and explains why President George W. Bush embarrasses him.

episodes.name: Greg Fitzsimmons (2)
episodes.overview: Greg Fitzsimmons describes how his chidren inspire him, explains why parents have morning sex and weighs in on life in Los Angeles.

episodes.name: Megan Mooney
episodes.overview: Megan Mooney talks about wrecking stuff with her nephews, dealing with questions about when she'll have kids of her own and the fan base of "The Price Is Right."

episodes.name: Tammy Pescatelli
episodes.overview: Tammy Pescatelli recalls performing at a Playboy benefit, explains the dangers of breast implants and weighs in on modern fashion trends.

episodes.name: Jon Reep
episodes.overview: Jon Reep shares his love of beer, demonstrates his childhood dance moves and impersonates an NFL referree.

episodes.name: Todd Barry (2)
episodes.overview: Todd Barry returns from a camp in Tahiti to share his story of a botched date with Julia Roberts and describes his great new apartment.

episodes.name: Arj Barker (2)
episodes.overview: Arj Barker expresses his disgust with Halloween's urban legend laziness, Citibank's terrible spelling and Google's haughty search suggestions.

episodes.name: Nick Swardson (2)
episodes.overview: Nick Swardson debuts a sexy new fragrance for men, explains his picky dating habits and wonders why people need reminders to not bring bombs on planes.

episodes.name: John Caparulo
episodes.overview: John Caparulo describes the downside of travel, recalls weird neighborhood yard sales and discusses living with exotic pets.

episodes.name: Andy Kindler
episodes.overview: Andy Kindler recalls his experience with marijuana in Amsterdam, examines the downside to the civil rights movement and describes his aversion to astrology.

episodes.name: Pat Dixon
episodes.overview: Pat Dixon talks about his experiences with drugs, explains why "fiance" is a more appealing term than "spouse" and justifies his preference for mid-level hotels.

episodes.name: Brian Kiley
episodes.overview: Brian Kiley recalls his wife’s unusual pregnancy cravings, his uncle’s unfortunate hunting accident and planning his marriage proposal.

episodes.name: Ben Bailey
episodes.overview: Ben Bailey explains why married life is incompatible with strip clubs, marvels at the stench of New York City and describes his misadventures on the subway.

episodes.name: Peter Berman
episodes.overview: Peter Berman explains why Las Vegas is simultaneously the best and the worst, why he always roots for the umpire, and why he stayed in a bad relationship for way too long.

episodes.name: Becky Pedigo
episodes.overview: Becky Pedigo shares stories about bombing in country western bars, cutting her own hair and her mother's racist safety advice.

episodes.name: Bill Santiago
episodes.overview: Bill Santiago explains why Spanglish is the perfect American language, recalls being a "Founding Papi" in a school play and waxes nostalgic for White Castle sliders.

episodes.name: Jeff Garcia
episodes.overview: Jeff Garcia explains how bad credit can have its advantages, lists which airlines terrorists shouldn't mess with and discusses his grandparents' contentious marriage.

episodes.name: Kyle Cease
episodes.overview: Kyle Cease thinks adults deserve recess more than kids, that real life should have cheat codes and that SunnyD is just the best worst beverage option.

episodes.overview: Everyone's favorite comedian musician is back with new songs and favorites from his latest album, "The Craig Machine."

episodes.name: Dan Cummins
episodes.overview: Dan Cummins explains how he plays tricks on blind friends, how he relaxes in the bathrooms at Starbucks, and his plan to decrease the homeless population in America and increase the surge in Iraq in this half-hour stand up special.

episodes.name: Jo Koy
episodes.overview: Jo Koy talks about life growing up with a Filipino mother, how everyone in LA is an actress even the actors, and speculates how long it took God to create the male and female sex organs in this half-hour stand up special.

episodes.overview: Tune in for a half hour of standup from Sebastian Maniscalco.

episodes.name: Hard 'N Phirm
episodes.overview: Hard 'N Phirm use their musical abilities to muse about women in the work place, savage garden, and things they can do that aren't illegal in this half-hour stand up special.

episodes.name: Nick Thune
episodes.overview: Guitarist Nick Thune strums along to songs about the awkwardness of running into the homeless at a Coinstar machine, how to kill two birds with one stone, and his ode to Craigslist miss connections in this half-hour stand up special.
